title: OnOptions
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Consultants Are the New C-Suite
items.description: Layoffs have sent an elite pool of talent into the consulting world, creating plenty of opportunities for businesses and consultants.

items.title: Science Says a Longer Commute to Work Is Almost Never Worth the Money
items.description: At a minimum, the opportunity will need to pay 40 percent more for the tradeoff to be worth it.

items.title: Rivian CEO says midprice EV sales are still 50% Tesla: ‘That’s not a reflection of a healthy market’
items.description: Lackluster demand for electric cars in the U.S. isn’t because Americans don’t want them, RJ Scaringe said. There’s just few good options.

items.title: These sites and apps will help you assemble the perfect holiday reading list
items.description: As readers look to curl up with a proverbial good book this winter—and put their holiday bookstore gift cards to work—they’ll be faced with an obvious...

items.title: BJ’s Wholesale Club is opening 9 new stores in 2026. Here’s the full list of locations coming soon
items.description: BJ’s Wholesale Club is planning to open nine new U.S. stores in 2026, and already debuted a new location on December 17 in Casselberry, Florida—its th...

items.title: Neuroscience Just Discovered a Weird Way to Tell When Someone Is Really Listening to You
items.description: Watching when people blink can help you tell whether you have their attention.

items.title: Apple’s Leadership Exodus Isn’t a Crisis. It’s Just Smart Transition Planning
items.description: Everyone seems to be leaving Apple, but maybe that’s a good thing.

items.title: Elon Musk says there will be ‘no poverty’ in the future, implying Ray Dalio’s multi-million Trump Account pledge will be essentially redundant
items.description: "It is certainly a nice gesture," Musk said. "But there will be no poverty in the future and so no need to save money."

items.title: This 1 Tweak to Your Body Language Makes You Much More Persuasive, Says a Study of 2,000 TED Talks
items.description: How to instantly win people over with some Italian influence.

items.title: ‘Big Short’ investor Michael Burry piles misery onto tech stocks after Oracle fails to close AI debt deal
items.description: Of course, Burry has a conflict of interest in the form of a $1.1 billion short bet against AI stocks. So take his doom-mongering with a pinch of salt...

items.title: Wear my brand: Why branded merch is the next post-ironic trend
items.description: You’ve probably seen them: clutch purses designed to look like croissants, anime-inspired hot sauce gear , purposefully ketchup-stained shirts , and e...

items.title: Octopus could be the next commercially farmed seafood. Should it be?
items.description: Balancing on a railroad-tie-size beam of a platform floating in Spain’s Vigo Bay, Ricardo Tur crouches and points below. Dangling several feet underwa...

items.title: Indie bookstores are making a shocking, triumphant comeback
items.description: The small American bookstore is back. Over the last five years, the number of independent bookstores in the U.S. jumped by 70%. In 2025 alone, 422 new...

items.title: A federal investigation is underway after Nevada’s safety regulator suddenly dropped violations against Boring Company
items.description: Lawyers and regulators say the Nevada state agency’s handling of the safety investigation went against procedure.

items.title: Exclusive: Swedish startup automating mechanical, electrical, and plumbing design for commercial buildings raises $20 million in seed round
items.description: Endra says it can reduce the time needed to design electrical systems from months to hours.
